subject: Re: [junit] JUnit and EJB! please help, a beginner
msgSnippet: Take a look at JBoss (www.jboss.org) which is an open source J2EE Server. First off download the newest 3.x release and then grab the documentation. Most of
messageBody:
Take a look at JBoss (www.jboss.org) which is an open source J2EE Server.
First off download the newest 3.x release and then grab the documentation.
Most of the documentation costs money but there is a getting started guide
that is free (It is way at the bottom of the documentation page). Start
out by reading chapters 1, 2, 6, and 9.

And just to make things less daunting a .jar file is just a glorified zip
file. The jar tool (It came with your jdk) uses the same syntax as the
unix tar command so:
jar -cf sample.jar sample -> takes the contents of the sample
directory and puts it in a jar file named sample.jar
jar -xf sample.jar -> unpacks the contents of sample.jar

A .war file is just a .jar file with webapp deployment descriptors in it.
A .ear file is just a .jar file with a collection of .jar and .war files
along with enterprise application deployment descriptors in it.

Good luck,
-Phil




"james_khu"
<james_khu@yahoo To: junit@yahoogroups.com
.com> cc:
Subject: [junit] JUnit and EJB! please help, a
04/19/03 01:53 beginner
AM
Please respond
to junit






Hi

I am a graduate student at a local university. I was just given a
research project on how to do both unit testing and load testing of
EJB. They told me to explore the possibility of using JUnit to unit
test EJB.

I must say that I am still pretty new at this EJB, tomcat, and
JUnit. my previous programming experience has been java IO,applet,
swing, and some servlet.

Can any of you guys give a pointer on where is the best place to
start looking for simple sample codes to run and play with ? I look
into jakarta.cactus website, but they don;t offer step by step
instructions on how to begin testing ejb. I don't even know how to
pack EAR, WAR, or jar file.

any help would be greatly appreciated
